messages.message:
Gazan journalists: about 50 dead in the past day as a result of IDF attacks in the center of the Gaza Strip (central camps).

The IDF is focusing most of its attacks on the camps in the center of the Gaza Strip with an emphasis on Nuseirat.

Gaza Strip

Throughout the night and day, airstrikes on various targets in the Gaza Strip continued, with an emphasis on the camps in the center of the Strip. About 30 people were killed in the last day as a result of these attacks.

Attached is documentation from the results of the attack on the home of the Zidem family today at noon in Nuseirat in the center of the Gaza Strip (camp 1). Nine deaths were recorded there.

Tel Aviv news: Air attack leaves 1 dead, at least 10 injured in Israel, military saysTEL AVIV, Israel -- A large explosion rumbled through the streets of central Tel Aviv early Friday morning, raining down shards of shrapnel and injuring at least 10 people, first responders said.
Israel's military said that they were reviewing the explosion and increasing air patrols after the incident, which its initial inquiries determined was caused by "an aerial target."
It was not immediately clear how the strike evaded Israel's air defenses or how Israel might respond.
But until Friday, all were intercepted by either Israel or Western allies with forces stationed in the region.
Israel's emergency response service, said at least 10 people were being treated for injuries, while a 50-year-old man was pronounced dead after the attack.

A large explosion tore through the streets of central Tel Aviv early on Friday morning, raining down shards of shrapnel and injuring at least 10 people.
Israel’s emergency response service said those injured were being treated for their injuries, while a 50-year-old man was pronounced dead at the scene.
Israel’s military said they were reviewing the explosion and increasing air patrols after the incident which Tel Aviv Mayor Ron Huldai on X, formerly Twitter, called a drone strike.
However, a spokesperson for Israel’s military said on Friday that the explosive-laden drone had been identified on Thursday and attributed the hit to “human error”.
Hamas’ October attack killed 1,200 people, mostly civilians, and militants took about 250 hostage.

People gather at the scene of an deadly explosion in Tel Aviv, Israel, early Friday, July 19, 2024.
Tel Aviv Mayor Ron Huldai on X called the attack a drone strike, though the military has not yet specified the nature of the attack.
There have been no claims of responsibility regarding the attack, which sent Tel Aviv into high alert on Friday.
Local police in Tel Aviv said that the blast sounded at around 3:10 a.m. on Friday morning, reverberating to nearby cities and physically injuring at least 10 people.
Tel Aviv District Commander Peretz Amar said officers could not locate the point of contact, suggesting the explosion occurred in the air.

Tel Aviv: Tel Aviv was jolted awake by a powerful explosion in a building on Friday morning, as per the reports by Israeli officials.
Local media reported that the site of the explosion was close to the US Consulate in Tel Aviv.
Blast in Tel Aviv caused by a drone: Israel Defense Forces confirmsThe issue was under “thorough investigation,” after the drone managed to enter Israeli airspace without setting off sirens, the Israel Defense Forces(IDF) statement said.
1 Dead, 8 Wounded After Blast Heard in Tel Aviv Explosion: ReportAs per the Times of Israel, the Magen David Adom ambulance service said that a man had been killed by shrapnel from the explosion of a drone in Tel Aviv.

Israeli defence forces have reported that a drone exploded in Tel Aviv on Friday morning.
Local media reported that the site of the explosion was close to the US Consulate in Tel Aviv.
Times of Israel reported that the Israel Defense Forces confirmed the blast in Tel Aviv was caused by a drone, saying an initial probe determined that "an aerial target" impacted the coastal city.
The IDF statement said that the issue was under "thorough investigation," after the drone managed to enter Israeli airspace without setting off sirens.

The explosion, which did not trigger air raid alarms, occurred hours after the Israeli military confirmed it had killed a senior commander of the Iran-backed Hezbollah militia in southern Lebanon.

'At What Cost': Guard Chief Argues Border Mission Is Getting in the Way of WarfightingThe outgoing chief of the National Guard is doubling down on his recent criticisms of the service component's long-troubled security mission on the U.S.-Mexico border, saying it's a detriment to the Guard's ability to wage war.
At its peak, 10,000 Guardsmen were part of the operation, which is in addition to a federal border mission of some 2,500 Guardsmen.
It also has been contributing to retention issues that have plagued the Army National Guard.
The National Guard has frequently been caught in the middle betweens state politicians and federal officials.
Related: The National Guard Is Stuck in the Middle of Political Infighting, and It's Getting Worse

At its peak, 10,000 Guardsmen were part of the operation, which is in addition to a federal border mission of some 2,500 Guardsmen.
A border mission, even a shorter one that can span about a month, consumes a significant chunk of a part-time Guardsman's duty time in a given year.
It also has been contributing to retention issues that have plagued the Army National Guard.
The National Guard has frequently been caught in the middle betweens state politicians and federal officials.
Related: The National Guard Is Stuck in the Middle of Political Infighting, and It's Getting Worse

CAIRO, July 19 (Reuters) - The United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) said on Friday that a vessel has been hit by unknown projectiles 83 nautical miles southeast of Yemen's Aden.
All crew are reported safe, UKMTO said in an advisory note.
Since November, Houthi militants in Yemen have launched drone and missile strikes in shipping lanes in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.
The group has said its actions are in solidarity with Palestinians affected by Israel's war in Gaza.
Britain and the U.S. have conducted retaliatory strikes since February, shooting down drones and bombing attack sites in Yemen.

A vessel has been struck by unknown projectiles 83 nautical miles southeast of Yemen's Aden, according to the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) on Friday.
Despite the incident, all crew members are reported safe.
The UKMTO did not identify the vessel involved.
Since November, Houthi militants in Yemen have heightened drone and missile strikes in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.
In response, Britain and the U.S. have conducted retaliatory strikes since February, targeting and neutralizing drones and bombing attack sites in Yemen.

TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — A large explosion rumbled through the streets of central Tel Aviv early Friday morning after an apparent drone strike caused shards of shrapnel to rain down and injure at least 10 people, authorities said.
Tel Aviv Mayor Ron Huldai on X called the attack a drone strike, though the military has not yet specified the nature of the attack.
Yemen’s Houthis have repeatedly launched drones and missiles toward Israel throughout the nine-month-long war in sympathy with Hamas.

A man watches from his window at the scene of an explosive drone attack in Tel Aviv, Israel, Friday, July 19, 2024.
Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for a drone believed to have exploded above Tel Aviv early Friday morning.
(AP Photo/Oded Balilty)TEL AVIV – Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for a drone strike early Friday that hit part of central Tel Aviv near the U.S. Embassy, killing one person and injuring 10.
“It was a terror attack that was targeted to kill civilians in Israel,” the official said of the strike, the first to threaten Tel Aviv in months.
The Houthi strike hit hours after Israel’s military confirmed one of its airstrikes had killed a Hezbollah commander and other militants in southern Lebanon.

Associated PressTEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Yemen’s Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for a drone strike early Friday that hit part of central Tel Aviv near the U.S. Embassy, killing one person and injuring 10.
The Houthis have launched drones and missiles toward Israel throughout the Israel-Hamas war, in solidarity with the Palestinian people and against Israel.
“It was a terror attack that was targeted to kill civilians in Israel,” the official said of the strike, the first to threaten Tel Aviv in months.
The Houthi strike hit hours after Israel’s military confirmed one of its airstrikes had killed a Hezbollah commander and other militants in southern Lebanon.
Friday’s drone strike on Tel Aviv could resurface fears about the war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas expanding into a regionwide conflagration as international mediators continue to push for a cease-fire.

TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) – An Iranian-made drone sent by Yemen’s Houthi rebels struck Tel Aviv on Friday, leaving one person dead and at least 10 wounded in the group’s first lethal strike into Israel.
Most have failed even to reach Israel’s southernmost city, Eilat, on the Red Sea some 270 kilometers (160 miles) south of Tel Aviv.
Israel’s military identified the drone as an Iranian Samad-3 upgraded to travel long distances and said it was believed to have come from Yemen.
The Houthi strike hit hours after Israel’s military confirmed one of its airstrikes had killed a Hezbollah commander and other militants in southern Lebanon.
Friday’s drone strike on Tel Aviv could resurface fears about the war in Gaza becoming a regionwide conflagration.

An Iranian-made drone sent by Yemen's Houthi rebels struck Tel Aviv on Friday, leaving one person dead and at least 10 wounded in the group's first lethal strike into Israel.
The aerial strike — the first lethal Houthi attack in Israel — rumbled through the center of the city near the U.S. Embassy, causing shrapnel to rain down and spreading shards of glass over a large radius.
The Houthi strike, the first to threaten Tel Aviv, hit at around 3:10 a.m. Local police said it reverberated to nearby cities and physically injured at least 10 people.
The Houthi strike hit hours after Israel’s military confirmed one of its airstrikes had killed a Hezbollah commander and other militants in southern Lebanon.
Friday’s drone strike on Tel Aviv could resurface fears about the war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas expanding into a regionwide conflagration as international mediators continue to push for a cease-fire.

“It was a terror attack that was targeted to kill civilians in Israel,” the official said of the strike, the first to threaten Tel Aviv in months.
The Houthi strike hit hours after Israel’s military confirmed one of its airstrikes had killed a Hezbollah commander and other militants in southern Lebanon.

An Iranian-made drone sent by struck Israel on Friday, leaving one person dead and at least 10 wounded in a neighborhood near the U.S. Embassy in Tel Aviv.
The aerial strike — the first lethal Houthi attack in Israel — rumbled through the center of the city, causing shrapnel to rain down and spreading shards of glass over a large radius.
The Houthi strike, the first to threaten Tel Aviv, hit at around 3:10 a.m. Local police said it reverberated to nearby cities and physically injured at least 10 people.

Tel Aviv [Israel], July 19 (ANI) After Tel Aviv was hit by a drone in which one person was killed and at least 10 others injured, mayor Ron Huldai said the city was "moving to a higher state of alert", reported the Times of Israel on Friday.
Israeli defence forces reported that a drone exploded in Tel Aviv on Friday morning.
Local media reported that the site of the explosion was close to the US Consulate in Tel Aviv.
Times of Israel reported that the Israel Defence Forces confirmed the blast in Tel Aviv was caused by a drone, saying an initial probe determined that "an aerial target" impacted the coastal city.
The missile and three of the drones were reportedly shot down by US forces based in the region, and only the fourth drone managed to reach Tel Aviv, the Times of Israel further reported.

Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) have reported that a drone exploded in Tel Aviv on Friday morning, leaving one person dead and at least ten others injured.
Local media reported that the site of the blast was close to the US Consulate in Tel Aviv.
The Times of Israel reported that the Israel Defence Forces confirmed the blast in Tel Aviv was caused by a drone, stating that an initial probe determined that “an aerial target” impacted the coastal city.
The IDF statement said that the issue was under “thorough investigation,” after the drone managed to enter Israeli airspace without setting off sirens.
